t: Prayer for Protection from the Wicked.
For the choir director; for flute accompaniment. A Psalm of David.
Give*pn ear to my words, O Lord,*s Consider*ln my groaning.
Heed*ln the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God, For*ln to You I pray.
In*ln the morning, O Lord,*s You will hear my voice; In*ln the morning I will order my*i prayer*i to You and eagerly*i watch.
For*ln You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness; No*ln evil dwells with You.
The*ln boastful shall not stand before Your eyes; You*ln hate all who do iniquity.
You*ln destroy those who speak falsehood; The*ln Lord*s abhors the man of bloodshed and deceit.
But*ln as for me, by Your abundant lovingkindness I will enter Your house, At*ln Your holy temple I will bow in reverence for You.
O*ln Lord,*s lead me in Your righteousness because of my foes; Make*ln Your way straight before me.
There*ln is nothing reliable in what they say; Their*ln inward part is destruction itself.*i Their*ln throat is an open grave; They*ln flatter with their tongue.
Hold*ln them guilty, O God; By*ln their own devices let them fall! In*ln the multitude of their transgressions thrust them out, For*ln they are rebellious against You.
But*ln let all who take refuge in You be glad, Let*ln them ever sing for joy; And*ln may You shelter them, That*ln those who love Your name may exult in You.
For*ln it is You who blesses the righteous man, O Lord,*s You*ln surround him with favor as with a shield.
